*Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive.*
*Our 24,000 experts globally specialize in cloud, data, and software, serving thousands of enterprise and public-sector customers in more than 90 countries. Tietoevry’s annual turnover is approximately EUR 3 billion and the company’s shares are listed on the NASDAQ exchange in Helsinki and Stockholm, as well as on Oslo Børs.*
 Additional Information
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity.
   

  

 Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Automation and Mechatronics Scientist, ABB Research
description:
At ABB, we help industries outrun - leaner and cleaner. Here, progress is an expectation - for you, your team, and the world. As a global market leader, we’ll give you what you need to make it happen. It won’t always be easy, growing takes grit. But at ABB, you’ll never run alone. Run what runs the world.


This Position reports to:


R&D Team Lead **Your role and responsibilities**


In this role you will be part of ABB Research in Västerås Sweden. In our role as ABB Research, we ensure ABB's technology competitiveness now and in the future.


In ABB Research we focus on automation concepts, design and machine intelligence in both industrial and service segments. We work closely with ABB's business units to ensure our research will bring unique value for ABB's future business. At the same time, we have close collaboration with the academic world to bridge the academic and industrial research.


In this position, your major focus will be to develop automation and mechatronics technologies and concepts. This includes automation system design, development of electrical/embedded systems, communication, digital twins, and motion control, as well as system testing.


Responsibilities include:

* Independently explore the whole chain as stated in above example
* Collaborate closely within / across teams both inside the research organization, stakeholders, and receivers in ABB business side.

**Qualifications for the role**

* MSc degree of education in automation or mechatronics engineering or equivalent.
* Solid knowledge on system development including, design and usage of automation systems, actuation and control, control software, etc.
* Hands on experience on automation/mechatronics system development.
* Capable of working both independently and in a team.
* Good communication skills in the English language.

**More about us**


Recruiting Manager: Linus Thrybom. Union representatives – Sveriges Ingenjörer Mikael Blomqvist, +46 768 06 00 11; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Katja Saari, +46 730 77 05 02.


We look forward to reading your application in PDF format. Last day to apply is August 5. Please note that the interview process is ongoing, apply now to secure your spot in the recruitment process!

  

Please note that to be eligible for employment at ABB Sweden, you will need to pass our pre-employment screening steps. This includes a reference check, a drug test, and could also include an extended background check.

  

We kindly decline direct contact with staffing and recruitment agencies as well as sellers of additional job advertisements.


We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe.

title: Simulation Engineer
description:
Lund, Skåne County, Sweden


Category: Engineering Hire Type: Employee
**Job ID** 12308 **Date posted** 07/22/2025  
**We Are:**


At Synopsys, we drive the innovations that shape the way we live and connect. Our technology is central to the Era of Pervasive Intelligence, from self-driving cars to learning machines. We lead in chip design, verification, and IP integration, empowering the creation of high-performance silicon chips and software content. Join us to transform the future through continuous technological innovation.


Our HAPS platform is the industry-leading FPGA-based prototyping solution, delivering state-of-the-art hardware and advanced software for best-in-class integrated prototyping. The Synopsys Lund team is at the forefront of new product development and support for HAPS hardware, providing unique opportunities to participate in every stage of the design process—from specification to validation.

 **You Are:**


You are a passionate and detail-oriented simulation engineer, eager to make a significant impact in the realm of hardware prototyping and thermal analysis. With a strong foundation in thermal engineering, you thrive on solving complex challenges and are motivated by the opportunity to innovate in a collaborative, high-tech environment. You have at least five years of relevant experience and a deep understanding of thermal phenomena in electronic systems, especially as they relate to PCB layouts and FPGA-based hardware.


You are comfortable navigating the entire product lifecycle, from pre-design predictions to hands-on validation in the lab. Your curiosity drives you to continuously learn and new methods, staying ahead of the latest advancements in electronics thermal analysis. You are recognized for your analytical thinking and adept problem-solving, and you value clear, effective communication with colleagues across disciplines.

 **What You’ll Be Doing:**

* Conduct pre-design thermal simulations for PCB layouts to optimize hardware performance and reliability.
* Perform system-level thermal analysis to identify and mitigate potential hotspots and ensure efficient cooling strategies.
* Utilize flow analysis tools to evaluate and enhance airflow management in complex hardware systems.
* Design and execute post-design verification protocols, including thermal measurements and data analysis.
* Develop and implement thermal test procedures in climate chambers to validate simulation results and hardware robustness.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams—hardware, firmware, and manufacturing—to drive design improvements and ensure seamless integration.
* Document simulation methodologies, results, and recommendations for internal knowledge sharing and process optimization.
* Stay abreast of emerging technologies and contribute to continuous process improvement within the R&D team.

 **The Impact You Will Have:**

* Enable the delivery of robust, high-performance FPGA-based prototyping platforms by ensuring optimal thermal design and management.
* Reduce development cycle times by providing precise thermal predictions and early design insights.
* Enhance product reliability and customer satisfaction by validating hardware under a wide range of thermal scenarios.
* Contribute to the continuous innovation of HAPS, maintaining Synopsys’ leadership in the prototyping space.
* Support the development of next-generation electronic systems that power critical applications worldwide.
* Promote knowledge sharing and best practices within the team, elevating the collective expertise of the R&D group.

 **What You’ll Need:**

* Master’s degree in thermal analysis, mechanical engineering, or a related field.
* Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience in electronics thermal analysis and simulation.
* Proficiency in at least three of the following: PCB layout thermal prediction, system thermal analysis, flow analysis, verification of results, thermal measurements, and thermal test design in climate chambers.
* Strong problem-solving and debugging skills, with a proven record of tackling complex technical challenges.
* Excellent written and spoken communication skills in English.
* Experience with hardware design involving FPGAs or the application of FPGAs in other domains (preferred).
* Programming or scripting expertise to support simulation and automation tasks (preferred).

 **Who You Are:**

* Collaborative and supportive, valuing teamwork and shared success.
* Curious and eager to learn, always seeking new knowledge in electronics and thermal engineering.
* Adaptable, able to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced R&D environment.
* Proactive and self-driven, with a strong sense of ownership over your work.
* Kind, respectful, and committed to fostering an inclusive and positive workplace.

 **The Team You’ll Be A Part Of:**

You’ll join the Synopsys Lund R&D team, a group of dedicated engineers focused on developing and supporting the HAPS hardware platform. Our team values innovation, open communication, and continuous learning. We work closely together across disciplines to deliver advanced prototyping solutions that power the next generation of semiconductor products.

 **Rewards and Benefits:**

We offer a comprehensive range of health, wellness, and financial benefits to cater to your needs. Our total rewards include both monetary and non-monetary offerings


At Synopsys, we want talented people of every background to feel valued and supported to do their best work. Synopsys considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, military veteran status, or disability.
company_description: Synopsys is a valued partner for silicon to systems design across a wide range of vertical markets, empowering technology innovators with the industry’s most comprehensive and trusted solutions.

title: TS Field Engineer
description:
**This is where you save and sustain lives**

At Baxter, we are deeply connected by our mission. No matter your role at Baxter, your work makes a positive impact on people around the world. You'll feel a sense of purpose throughout the organization, as we know our work improves outcomes for millions of patients.


Baxter's products and therapies are found in almost every hospital worldwide, in clinics and in the home. For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.


Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. This is where you can do your best work.


Join us at the intersection of saving and sustaining lives—where your purpose accelerates our mission.


The Field Engineer is responsible for the service activity on products supplied by Baxter/Hillrom in Nordics and base of operations is in Rosersberg - Stockholm. They will need to undertake their duties in compliance with assigned company procedures (e.g. Control of Service Documentation, Environmental Health & Safety).  



**Key Responsibilities:**

* Install, service, repair and maintain products, distributed by Baxter/Hillrom in the defined area of responsibility as per the defined service documentation and the quality system framework.
* Establish & maintain timely customer communications & relationships, along with other key partners (e.g. team members and business units).
* Report all relevant service activity, ensuring updated and accurate service data in the service system (all work orders should be closed within the same day).
* Responsible for maintaining and documenting the assigned calibration equipment.
* Provide technical support for in-bound calls from customer & patients, document the job on the system and undertake the relevant actions.
* Maintain up-to-date technical competence in assigned products by effectively completing the relevant training and development.
* Find opportunities for new business or business growth for products & services and raise to the relevant partners (e.g. account managers, Inside Sales).
* Review KPIs regularly and adapt the working practices to ensure service level is maximised.
* Plan and perform qualified technical training to distributors, partners, and colleagues.
* Coordinate and disseminate technical updates and bulletins.
* Be the technical guide and support for customers, account managers and engineers. This includes being the technical issue point for the designated product group.
* Raise and communicate updates to the monthly SME calls.
* Represent UKIN interests in EMEA/Global technical community.
Provide technical feedback into contracts & tender submissions.  
* 

**Job Requirements:**

* Practical experience within medical industry.
* Degree, HNC/HND or equivalent level qualification in the relevant engineering field is preferable, but not essential.
* Good IT knowledge on general connectivity, network integration of devices, wireless protocols, mobile network technologies, software support and cyber security standards would be advantageous.
* Frequent and regular travel within the assigned geographical region in Sweden/Nordics.
* Driving license.
* Fluid in Swedish and English language.

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

Baxter is an equal opportunity employer. Baxter evaluates qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, disability/handicap status or any other legally protected characteristic.


**Reasonable Accommodations**  

  

Baxter is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities globally. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or interview process, please click on the link here and let us know the nature of your request along with your contact information.


**Recruitment Fraud Notice**  

  

Baxter has discovered incidents of employment scams, where fraudulent parties pose as Baxter employees, recruiters, or other agents, and engage with online job seekers in an attempt to steal personal and/or financial information. To learn how you can protect yourself, review our Recruitment Fraud Notice .
company_description: Every day, millions of patients and caregivers rely on Baxter’s leading portfolio of critical care, nutrition, hospital and surgical products.

title: Field Service Engineer II
description:
Overview


* Are you looking for an impactful role for a fast-growing company that helps advance science and human well-being?
* Would you like the freedom of being field based where no day is the same and you get the opportunity to become a trusted advisor to our customers?
* Are you looking for lots of opportunities to grow, develop, learn, and progress in your career?
* Do you want to work for a global best-in-class, innovative technology organization who are highly focussed and committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion?


If your answers are yes, then we would love to hear from you!  

At Waters, we design and manufacture innovative products, solutions, and services to help our customers solve their scientific challenges. The people who work for us make a real difference in solving problems that matter, they are passionate and proud of their work and accomplishments, making Waters a great place to work.  

As a **Field Customer Support Specialist,** you will support customers across a wide variety of lab-based scientific business sectors meaning your role is very diverse and interesting, no two days are the same!  

With Waters being a Global Organization, there are endless opportunities for you to learn, grow and develop. Many of our team members have advanced their careers either in their current roles or moving into different parts of our business such as applications support, sales, global support, and leadership.
Responsibilities


**So, what do our Field Customer Support Specialists do? Below are some of the key responsibilities:*** Install, qualify, validate, calibrate, maintain, and repair Waters systems.
* Analyse and review system and scientific data to determine the source of problems and recommend repair, replacement, or other corrective actions.
* Coordinate problem resolution with our matrix teams to help expedite repairs and deliver customer satisfaction.
* Manage customer expectations by communicating work performed and providing follow-up plans if required.
* Build strong rapport and trusted advisor partnerships with our customer base to provide them with suitable advice and support on Waters products and services – always looking for potential opportunities as to how Waters can further advance their laboratory operations.


To help achieve the above, you will get the best possible training, be supported by a fantastic team, and embark on a continuous learning and development pathway.
Qualifications


**Who are we looking for?*** We ask that you are interested in science, problem-solving, service, and people!
* You could have a laboratory, analytical, chemistry, or engineering background.
* It’s important that you are flexible and enjoy variety in your role as well as being able to build trusted relationships with our customers.


Waters recognizes that there is an under-representation of people from diverse backgrounds within STEM careers and we recognize some groups face marginalization through the job application process. As an inclusive employer, we welcome applications from everyone; you don’t need to meet all the requirements of the role – if you feel you can add value to our business, we want to hear from you. **Rewards**
In return, we offer a highly competitive, market-leading benefits package for our employees:  

* Flexibility - We offer a lot of flexibility within your day both with your time and tasks.
* Great Opportunities for growth, development, and progression
* Competitive salary and incentive
* Company Car
* Wellbeing Programs and Services, Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP)
* Private Health Care
* Strong pension contribution
* Employee Insurance (Life Insurance, Accident Insurance, Disability Protection, Global Business Travel Accident Insurance)
* Paid Annual Leave (5 weeks) plus statutory days
* Maternity & Paternity Leave
* Education/Tuition Reimbursement where applicable
* Social events on the calendar
* Great working environment surrounded by great people


Company Description


Waters Corporation (NYSE:WAT) is a global leader in analytical instruments, separations technologies, and software, serving the life, materials, food, and environmental sciences for over 65 years. Our Company helps ensure the efficacy of medicines, the safety of food and the purity of water, and the quality and sustainability of products used every day. In over 100 countries, our 7,600+ passionate employees collaborate with customers in laboratories, manufacturing sites, and hospitals to accelerate the benefits of pioneering science. *Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It benefits our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters complies with all applicable federal, state, and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All hiring decisions are based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.*
company_description: Waters is unlocking the potential of science by solving problems that matter. Are you ready to unlock your next opportunity with us?

title: Completions Specialist / Quality Inspector
description:
**Description**


**The Opportunity**


HVDC (High Voltage Direct Current) is a product group in Hitachi, which develops, manufactures and sells DC transmission systems on a global market. HVDC technology is used to transmit electricity over long distances and for power transmission via submarine cables. It is also used to connect power systems.


We are now hiring a Completion Specialist to HVDC Sweden, a business line within Hitachi. As Completions Specialist you have a key role in the project by being responsible to perform inspections at Suppliers to ensure the equipment is manufactured according to the requirements. Work tasks are split between operational site visits to suppliers, performing inspections, and traveling. Strategic tasks as part of the department and different project teams for you to give input, report on findings, and work with other stakeholders both internal and external in preparation of and feedback about inspections.


We are interested to learn more about you and what you can contribute with so don’t hesitate to apply even though you don’t meet all requirements. A team with great cooperation and with diverse backgrounds is waiting for you to join!

**How you’ll make an impact**

* Understand the contract, specifications, budget, scope and other relevant project documentation related to the different types of equipment in the scope of the HVDC stations.
* Participate and be a decisive team player in the coordination meetings where inspections are distributed within the Completion Specialists.
* Perform inspections in line with the time schedule and the different contractual milestones, producing the inspection reports according to the project requirements.
* You care about delivering quality to the Customer and are not afraid to highlight the Customer's needs to the supplier to provide the best solution to the Customer.
* Identify, estimate and report cost savings or cost avoidance based on outcome of the inspections.
* Engage and support the stakeholders in the usage of the Project Completion System (PCS) database for tracking supplier inspections and punch items.
* Ensure all relevant documentation and punch items are correctly registered in the PCS including those identified during the Factory Acceptance Tests.
* Supervise the Suppliers in the completion of the Inspection and Test Records and punch items on a regular basis based on the scope.
* Raise deviations when deemed relevant based on punches.
* Takes part in completions meetings with customer, supplier, and Hitachi personnel and provide leadership on the actions assigned.

**Your background**

* Technical / Engineering / Quality management education or equivalent professional experience
* HVDC station equipment scope understanding a bonus
* Minimum 3+ years’ experience in a similar role.
* Knowledge and experience of working with a PCS such as PIMS and ProCoSys, or alternatively another similar inspection management software e.g., BIM 360 Field, Aconex Field, etc.
* Proficient oral and written communication skills including technical documentation and reporting
* Sensitive to Customer and project team needs and can develop a sustainable relationship to all involved stakeholders through clear communication, influencing and coordination
* English fluency (written + spoken)
* Availability to travel

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**


Are you ready for a new exciting challenge? Does the above description sound like you? Welcome to apply! Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis, so don’t delay – apply today!


Recruiting Manager Daniel Martinez, daniel.martinez@hitachienergy.com will be happy to answer your questions regarding this position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Mikael Hjort, +46 107-38 29 86; Unionen: Fredrik Holmgren, +46 107-38 21 85; Ledarna: Frank Hollstedt, +46 107-38 70 43. All other questions should be directed to Talent Partner Michael Blomberg Michael.blomberg@hitachienergy.com

**Qualified individuals with a disability may request a reasonable accommodation if you are unable or limited in your ability to use or access the Hitachi Energy career site as a result of your disability. You may request reasonable accommodations by completing a** **general inquiry form** **on our website. Please include your contact information and specific details about your required accommodation to support you during the job application process.**
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**This is solely for job seekers with disabilities requiring accessibility assistance or an accommodation in the job application process. Messages left for other purposes will not receive a response.**
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
company_description: Advancing a sustainable energy future for all

title: Engineering & Science - Software Engineering
company_industry: Hospitals and Health Care, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Software Development
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope.**
 Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. We are leaders in precision radiation therapy, we're committed to ensuring everyone has access to the best cancer care possible. Are you as passionate about humanity and innovation as we are? Then we would love to meet you!
   

  

 Elekta is recruiting two
 **Software Verification Engineers** 
 to the R&D team Engineer to expand the R&D team in our Neuro Business Line and we have opportunities for both new or recent graduates as well as experienced engineers. In this position you’ll be part of the team responsible for developing Leksell GammaPlan®. This position is located at Elekta’s new head office at the heart of Hagastaden in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

**Your team**
 The
 **Software Verification Engineer** 
 is a member of a scrum team responsible for development of the Leksell GammaPlan® product, which is a treatment planning software fully integrated with the Leksell Gamma Knife®. The Leksell Gamma Knife® is a non-invasive, precision stereotactic treatment device used to deliver focused radiation to intercranial targets.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 As a
 **Software Verification Engineer** 
 your primary responsibility will be verification and continuous test of our products. You will be a member of a cross functional agile scrum team that specifies, develops, and tests the software used for planning of radiation therapy and radiosurgery in a development organization that works according to the SAFe agile methodology.
   

  

 In this role you will be involved in all the phases of the development process including specifying requirements, test planning, test automation, test execution, defect reporting and writing formal verification reports. We have a focus on test automation using Python and the development and enhancement of our test automation framework.
   

  

 Medical technology is a highly regulated and process driven industry and therefore a quality mindset is important in all that we do.
   

  

 Your responsibilities include:
   

  

* Automating test cases both for test and verification
* Maintaining and updating our test automation framework
* Designing test cases
* Writing and reviewing test plans and test reports
* Executing manual test cases and performing exploratory testing
* Participating in risk reviews
* Contributing to continuous improvements
* Participate in the cross functional agile scrum teams


**The right stuff**
 To be a suitable candidate for this position we think you are a problem solver who is passionate about helping people through the development of medical technologies. Python programming skills are important, and a good knowledge of Linux is a merit. We think you are a driven and proactive team player with good communication skills who wants to work in an agile development environment.
   

  

 You have a bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering, computer science, medical technologies or related studies. Our business language is English so good written and spoken communication in English is important.
   

  

**Sound Interesting?**
 Apply now by clicking the “Apply” link. Please note that we do not accept applications via e-mail. We will read applications continuously so please send us your application today! Last day to apply is 2025-08-15.
 **Submit your CV and cover letter in English.**
 Our treatment solutions can be used to treat everyone and anyone, no matter who they are. Hence, we encourage applicants that are as diverse as the patients treated with our solutions.
   

  

*As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope. Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with offices in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit elekta.com or follow @Elekta on Twitter and LinkedIn.*

title: Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Engineer
description:
TMC i Stockholm växer och vi söker Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Engineer till vårt team Digital & IT! About this vacancy
   

  

 På TMC blir du en del av en innovativ och entreprenöriell organisation där fokuset ligger på ständig utveckling och möjligheten att vara ansvarig för din egen utveckling och affär. I rollen som Manufacturing Execution System (MES) Engineer söker vi dig som är en engagerad lagspelare som vill bidra till en omfattande digital transformation tillsammans med våra kunder i StorStockholm där du kommer att agera brygga mellan IT, automation och verksamheten. Dina arbetsuppgifter kan exempelvis inkludera; förvaltning, implementering och integrering mellan produktionssystem och affärssystem (ERP/MES/SCADA), modernisering av systemlandskapet, kravhantering, tekniska diskussioner och samarbete med andra produkt- och leveransteam.

title: Field Application Engineer / Systemarkitekt
company: Recab  - Reliable Technology for Mission Critical Industries
description:
Ligger du i hängmattan och funderar på att starta ett nytt äventyr?
 



 Vill du ha ett jobb där dina idéer inte bara fastnar på papper – utan faktiskt blir till hårdvara?
 



  





 Recab söker nu en
 **Field Application Engineer / Systemarkitekt** 
 som vill vara med och forma nästa generations inbyggda lösningar, från idé till verklighet.
 



  






 Recab specialiserar sig på dator- och kommunikationslösningar för industri och försvarsapplikationer. Våra produkter är designade för att fungera i krävande miljöer och kombinerar hög tillförlitlighet med avancerad teknik.
 




  





**Är det här du?** 



* Du gillar att stå vid whiteboarden tillsammans med kunden och skissa upp smarta lösningar.
* Du kan översätta komplexa tekniska behov till tydliga systemlösningar.
* Du trivs i mötet mellan teknik och affär – och gillar att imponera lite grann.



  





**Vad kommer du göra?** 



* Utforska kundens behov på djupet och guida fram till rätt lösning.
* Designa systemlösningar med rätt hårdvara, mjukvara och integration.
* Jobba tätt med våra säljare, leverantörer och tekniker för att göra kunderna riktigt nöjda.
* Ibland resa, ibland jobba hemifrån, ibland sitta på kontoret.



  





**Vad har du för bakgrund?** 




 Vi tror att du har några av dessa erfarenheter:
 


* Ingenjörsexamen inom elektronik, datateknik, systemvetenskap eller liknande.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av systemdesign eller systemarkitektur inom inbyggda system eller relaterade områden.
* Förståelse för både hårdvaru- och mjukvarukomponenter ur ett systemperspektiv.
* Teknisk bredd inom områden som CPU/GPU-plattformar (x86, ARM), realtidsoperativsystem, nätverk, AI på edge och säkerhetsaspekter.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta nära både sälj, utvecklingsteam och slutanvändare.
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift.



  





**Varför ska du jobba hos Recab AB?** 




 Hos Recab får du ett jobb där du är med tidigt i projekten och har möjlighet att påverka både teknikval och lösningar på riktigt. Du får chansen att arbeta med några av marknadens mest spännande kunder inom försvar, marin, automation och kritisk infrastruktur. När det behövs ingår resor till leverantörer och partners i Europa, Asien och USA, vilket ger både inspiration och kunskap. Allt detta gör du i en kultur där vi värdesätter teknik, samarbete och att skapa bra resultat tillsammans
 



  






 Tjänsten är på heltid med placering på vårt kontor i Hägersten, Stockholm.
 




  





**Låter allt detta intressant?** 




 Klicka på ansök eller skicka ett mejl till career@recab.com
 
  
 
 med några rader om dig själv och din CV.
